alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 11:28AM PST until February 03 at 1:32PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County. .Light rainfall tonight should not impact the Nooksack River but could delay the falling river levels on the Skokomish River. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM PST Monday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM PST Monday was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is falling but is expected to stay above flood stage for several days. This river is expected to start rising overnight Tuesday night to a crest of 17.4 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 730 PM PST.
